R.what is r language: R is a programming language and environment for statistical computing, data analysis, and graphics, widely used in data science and research.
R.what is r studio: RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R, providing a console, syntax-highlighting editor, and tools for plotting and workspace management.
R.what are r data types: R data types include numeric, integer, complex, logical, character, and raw, used to store different kinds of data.
R.what is r vector: A vector is a one-dimensional array of elements of the same type, created using c(), seq(), or rep() functions.
R.what is r list: A list is an ordered collection of elements that can be of different types, including other lists.
R.what is r matrix: A matrix is a two-dimensional array of elements of the same type, arranged in rows and columns.
R.what is r array: An array is a multi-dimensional data structure that can hold elements of the same type in more than two dimensions.
R.what is r data frame: A data frame is a table-like structure where each column can contain different types of data, commonly used for datasets.
R.what is r factor: A factor represents categorical data and stores both the values and their corresponding levels.
R.what is r scalar: A scalar is a single value in R, treated as a vector of length one.
R.what is r variable: A variable is a name assigned to store data in R, which can hold any data type.
R.what is r assignment operator: The assignment operator '<-' or '=' is used to assign values to variables in R.
R.what is r function: A function is a block of code that performs a specific task and can return a value, defined using function() keyword.
R.what is r argument: An argument is a value passed to a function when it is called.
R.what is r return value: Return value is the output produced by a function after execution.
R.what is r built-in function: R provides built-in functions like mean(), sum(), length(), str(), and head() for common operations.
R.what is r user-defined function: User-defined functions are custom functions created by the user using the function() syntax.
R.what is r if statement: If statement executes a block of code if a specified condition is true.
R.what is r else statement: Else statement executes a block of code when the if condition is false.
R.what is r else if statement: Else if allows multiple conditional checks sequentially after an if statement.
R.what is r for loop: For loop iterates over elements of a vector, list, or sequence and executes a block of code.
R.what is r while loop: While loop repeatedly executes a block of code as long as the condition remains true.
R.what is r repeat loop: Repeat loop executes a block of code indefinitely until a break statement is encountered.
R.what is r break statement: Break exits the nearest enclosing loop immediately.
R.what is r next statement: Next skips the current iteration of a loop and moves to the next iteration.
R.what is r vectorized operation: Vectorized operations allow element-wise computation on vectors without explicit loops.
R.what is r recycling rule: Recycling rule repeats elements of shorter vectors to match the length of longer vectors in operations.
R.what is r indexing: Indexing accesses elements of vectors, lists, matrices, or data frames using integers, logicals, or names.
R.what is r slicing: Slicing extracts a subset of elements from a vector, list, or matrix using index ranges.
R.what is r subsetting: Subsetting selects parts of data structures using [ ], [[ ]], or $ operators.
R.what is r missing value: Missing values are represented by NA in R, indicating absence of data.
R.what is r NULL: NULL represents the absence of any value or object in R.
R.what is r NaN: NaN (Not a Number) represents undefined or unrepresentable numerical results, like 0/0.
R.what is r Inf: Inf represents positive or negative infinity in R.
R.what is r vector functions: Common vector functions include length(), sum(), mean(), sort(), rev(), unique(), and order().
R.what is r list functions: List functions include length(), names(), unlist(), lapply(), sapply(), and append().
R.what is r matrix functions: Matrix functions include nrow(), ncol(), dim(), t(), rowSums(), colSums(), and diag().
R.what is r array functions: Array functions include dim(), dimnames(), apply(), and aperm() for dimension manipulation.
R.what is r data frame functions: Data frame functions include str(), head(), tail(), summary(), subset(), merge(), and transform().
R.what is r factor functions: Factor functions include levels(), nlevels(), as.numeric(), and factor().
R.what is r string: String is a sequence of characters, manipulated using quotes and string functions.
R.what is r string functions: String functions include nchar(), substr(), paste(), paste0(), strsplit(), grep(), gsub(), and toupper()/tolower().
R.what is r apply function: Apply executes a function over rows or columns of matrices or arrays.
R.what is r lapply function: Lapply applies a function over a list and returns a list.
R.what is r sapply function: Sapply applies a function over a list or vector and simplifies the result.
R.what is r vapply function: Vapply applies a function over a list or vector and returns a vector with a specified type.
R.what is r tapply function: Tapply applies a function over subsets of a vector defined by a factor or grouping variable.
R.what is r aggregate function: Aggregate applies functions over grouped data in vectors, data frames, or matrices.
R.what is r merge function: Merge combines two data frames by common columns or row names.
R.what is r subset function: Subset extracts subsets of vectors, matrices, or data frames based on conditions.
R.what is r data import: Data import functions read data from files: read.csv(), read.table(), read.xlsx(), and readRDS().
R.what is r data export: Data export functions write data to files: write.csv(), write.table(), saveRDS(), and write.xlsx().
R.what is r plot function: Plot function generates 2D graphs using x and y data, with customization options.
R.what is r ggplot2: Ggplot2 is a library for creating advanced and layered visualizations using the grammar of graphics.
R.what is r histogram: Histogram plots the distribution of numeric data into bins.
R.what is r barplot: Barplot represents categorical data as rectangular bars proportional to values.
R.what is r boxplot: Boxplot visualizes the spread, median, quartiles, and outliers of numeric data.
R.what is r scatter plot: Scatter plot shows the relationship between two numeric variables using points.
R.what is r line chart: Line chart visualizes trends in numeric data over a continuous variable, typically time.
R.what is r correlation: Correlation measures the strength and direction of linear relationship between two variables.
R.what is r covariance: Covariance measures the joint variability of two numeric variables.
R.what is r summary function: Summary provides descriptive statistics like mean, median, min, max, and quartiles for data.
R.what is r str function: Str displays the structure of an object, including data types, dimensions, and sample values.
R.what is r dim function: Dim returns the dimensions (rows and columns) of a matrix, array, or data frame.
R.what is r length function: Length returns the number of elements in a vector, list, or factor.
R.what is r names function: Names gets or sets the names of elements in a vector, list, or data frame columns.
R.what is r sample function: Sample randomly selects elements from a vector or generates random permutations.
R.what is r set.seed: Set.seed sets the starting point for random number generation to ensure reproducibility.
R.what is r runif: Runif generates random numbers uniformly distributed between specified min and max values.
R.what is r rnorm: Rnorm generates random numbers normally distributed with a specified mean and standard deviation.
R.what is r rbinom: Rbinom generates random numbers following a binomial distribution.
R.what is r rpois: Rpois generates random numbers following a Poisson distribution.
R.what is r install.packages: Install.packages installs a package from CRAN or other repositories.
R.what is r library function: Library loads an installed package into the current R session for use.
R.what is r require function: Require loads a package and returns TRUE if successful or FALSE if the package is not available.
R.what is r set working directory: Set working directory specifies the folder where R reads and writes files, using setwd().
R.what is r get working directory: Get working directory returns the current folder used by R for reading and writing files using getwd().
R.what is r help function: Help displays documentation for functions, packages, and datasets using help() or ? operator.
R.what is r ? operator: ? operator provides quick access to help pages for functions or objects.
R.what is r readline function: Readline reads a line of input from the console as a character string.
R.what is r as.numeric: As.numeric converts a value to numeric type.
R.what is r as.character: As.character converts a value to character type.
R.what is r as.factor: As.factor converts a value to factor type.
R.what is r na.omit: Na.omit removes missing values (NA) from a vector, matrix, or data frame.
R.what is r is.na: Is.na checks if elements are missing (NA) and returns a logical vector.
R.what is r complete.cases: Complete.cases identifies rows in data frames without any missing values.
R.what is r merge vs cbind vs rbind: Merge combines datasets by keys, cbind binds columns, rbind binds rows.
